msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Updated the viewport API per feedback from the Scroller/Viewport spec
review.  The previous Halo-esque API for specifying the desired number
of visible colunms in a HorizontalLayout or visible rows in a
VerticalLayout has been simplified.  I've itemized the changes for
VerticalLayout below; the HorizontalLayout changes are similar:
- The rowCount property is now read-only and Bindable.  It's value is
always the actual number of visible rows.  Note also: although
"visibleRowCount" might have more precise, Halo used the unqualifed
- A new property called requestedRowCount has been added.  It indicates
how many rows should be visible and is used exclusively by the layout's
- The protected explicitRowCount property has been removed.
The Horizontal and VerticalLayout classes now extend EventDispatcher
QE: This change will break tests that set the row,columnCount layout properties
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Substantially revised the Scroller component.  This version supports
the vertical,horizontalScrollPolicy properties (as in Halo) and no
longer includes a vestigal "viewportHolder" skin part.  Layout is
now handled programatically, instead of with MXML constraints.
There are still some limitations for the "auto" scroll policies, and
some other minor layout problems.  There is no documentation (yet).
Corrected minimum size calculation in Vertical,HorizontalLayout
for the cases where an explicit rowCount or columnCount was specified.
The measured min sizes are now only based on the first rowCount
QE: Scroller can now be tested

Added doc for the new "Group as Viewport" API.
Provisional fix for bug 16609, BasicLayout's contentWidth,Height

Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Group/Viewport changes per feedback from the kick-off meeting.
Group contentWidth,Height properties are now read-only.  Layouts
must set them with new method Group::setContentSize().
Layouts call setContentSize at both measure and updateDisplayList
time.  Doing so at measure time may be unnecessary although
the measured size of scrollbar thumbs can depend indirectly on
Group now updates its own scrollRect at updateDisplayList time, rather
than having each layout do so
